entry.title: Combined summary - Using service bit 24 for utreexo signaling in testnet and signet
entry.summary: On March 2, 2023, Luke Dashjr posted on the bitcoin-dev mailing list about using experimental service bits for experiments. He suggested that if the details of utreexo aren't finalized and may change, an experimental service bit makes sense. Bit 24 is currently unused, so it is fine to use it for signaling something. The full-rbf is currently using bit 26. Meanwhile, kcalvinalvin informed the mailing list that he'll be using service bit 24 to signal for something and requested others to coordinate with him if they are using the same bit to signal for something else.Calvin announced his intention to use service bit 24 (1 signet) for utreexo node binaries in a message to the bitcoin-dev mailing list. The decision was based on a comment in protocol.h in bitcoind, and there are plans to release binaries for the utreexo node in the coming months. However, Calvin has no immediate plans to release binaries for mainnet. He requested coordination with anyone else using the same bit to signal for something else.
